commits.message:
Merge pull request #4295 from Osmose/robust-poly-errors

Make the string representation of PolyStorageError more robust.
Make the string representation of PolyStorageError more robust.

Merge pull request #4290 from Osmose/setup-data

Fix bug 1399305: Script deletion and creation of S3 bucket and ES indices in development environment.

Review fixes.

- Fix S3 bucket script to ignore an error if the dev_bucket does not
  exist.
- Correct comment in run_update_data.sh.
- Log which indices are being deleted by the clear_es_indices app.
- Stop using minimum_es_version decorator in some tests.
- Improve how we parse a date from a socorro index name.

Include awscli in base requirements for single setup script.

This lets us remove some complexity around installing awscli, and allows the
make dockersetup commands to be executed by a single container.

Fix bug 1399305: Script elasticsearch index creation and deletion.

Modifies `make dockersetup` to clear out all Elasticsearch indexes, and
`make dockerupdatedata` to create Elasticsearch indexes for the next two weeks.
Bug 1399305: Delete and recreate dev S3 bucket in dockersetup.

Merge pull request #4289 from Osmose/fix-homepage

Fix bug 1429829: Use functions for `interpolate` param of metricsgraphics.js
Remind users of the system checklist to look at the JS console.

Fix bug 1429829: Use a function for the graph interpolate argument.

This changed in v2.10 of metricsgraphics.js, due to D3 v4.0 changes to how
shapes work. See also
https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/6480d20b3a352fcb579cd36ac34cfbb1f34b88c0/CHANGES.md#shapes-d3-shape.

Use un-minified source code as input for several libraries.

This makes it much easier to read errors during development since we're not
using minified files.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1431162: Fix errors in crontabber_status.js due to D3/sankey updates.
pull_requests.body:
- Fix some inconsistent indenting that was failing eslint.
- The `d.x`, `d.y`, and `d.dy` attributes on sankey datums appears to have been
  replaced with `d.x0`, `d.x1`, `d.y0`, and `d.y1`. So we replace all old
  attributes with the new ones (dy is computed from y0 and y1).
- Pass nodes and links via the sankey constructor.
- Replace `sankey.nodeWidth` call with a property computed from the datum's `x0`
  and `x1` values.
- Replace `sankey.update` with `sankey.relayout`.
- Replace `sankey.link` with `d3.sankeyLinkHorizontal`.

Most of these changes were found in the release notes on the sankey Github:
https://github.com/d3/d3-sankey/releases.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1429431: Use pyup to monitor and update e2e-tests dependencies.
pull_requests.body:
This PR does a few things:

1. Moves the dependency config for the e2e-tests into `e2e-tests/requirements/default.txt` and adds a constriants file for indirect dependencies. Both of these files perform hash checks for downloaded packages.
2. Adds the newly-created e2e-tests requirements to the pyup config.
3. Removes the `flake8` environment from the tox config, instead using the existing automation we have for linting python code in CircleCI and TravisCI. I'm not sure if this is being actively run anywhere.

   The downside of this is that we can't ignore line length only for the e2e-tests subdirectory, so I fixed the linting errors that this change brought up.

@stephendonner @chartjes Ya'll probably wanna look over this too before we merge it in case I've unknowingly broken some automation I'm not aware of or am otherwise messing up your stuff. This change will make it so that a PR for updating the test dependencies will be automatically filed once a month by the pyup bot, saving ya'll some human effort. :D

commits.message:
Merge pull request #4296 from amccreight/patch-14

Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

Merge pull request #4292 from willkg/1424659-spaces

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures
Merge three similar test cases into a single test case

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures

Prior to this, it was possible (though rare) to have two spaces in a row
in signatures. That's tough because the webui shows that as a single
space and if you search for the single-space version, you won't get any
results.

This fixes that by establishing that signatures can't have more than 1
consecutive whitespace character. Further, this makes sure that all
non-space whitespace characters are converted to space and this
happens all before we truncate the signature.

I also changed SigTrunc to SigTruncate because "trunc" is an unnecessary
abbreviation.

Merge pull request #4287 from willkg/1371428-nix-quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix ' to '' in signature generation

For years, there's been a bit of code to "escape single quotes" in
Java and C signatures. As near as I can tell, it predates the current
era of Socorro requirements and was likely added for some reason that
is no longer relevant.

One consequence is that it makes searching for frames harder, so this
removes that behavior.

Cleanup JavaSignatureRule tests

This renames all the JavaSignatureRule tests so they indicate what they're
testing. Plus it removes a couple of tests that are either an identical
duplicate or a close-enough-that-it's-effectively-the-same-thing duplicate.

Merge pull request #4288 from willkg/1416841-drop-dotstar

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

Since each line is a regexp that's joined with others with | and then
used with .match(), they're effectively all "startswith" type matches
so the .* at the end is superfluous.

Merge pull request #4286 from willkg/1426186-reprocess-help

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto
Reword note about balancing crash id production and consumption
Clarify how to specify a sleep value of 10

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto

This adds some crude documentation for reprocessing crashes including some
hand-wavey warnings about being cautious about adding crash ids to the queue
faster than they can be processed.

Merge pull request #4284 from willkg/1429434-rtd-fix

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

Simplify the Makefile

This moves the cp to always happen in the catch-all target rather than as
a separate target.

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

This fixes the docs build scripts such that readthedocs will copy the
e2e-tests README before building the docs. Otherwise, the e2e-tests README
doesn't get compiled into the docs on readthedocs.

Merge pull request #4283 from willkg/1155165-truncate

fixes bug 1155165 - truncate in one place
Fix SigTrunc to use a constant

pull_requests.title: fixes bug 1416340 - use secure args for ES connections
pull_requests.body:
If the `elasticsearch_urls` are all https, then we should be passing in
`verify_certs=True` and `use_ssl=True` args into the Elasticsearch
connection.

pull_requests.title: bug 1431442 - add "mark-success" to crontabber app
pull_requests.body:
This makes it easier to set up initial crontabber bookkeeping state in
the local development environment without having to run all the crontabber
jobs.

Mike: Do you think this helps? Is it good enough for a first pass? We can also do one for marking jobs as failed. I think that covers basic cases and after that it's probably easier to drop into psql and edit the db manually.

commits.message:
Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

ReleaseData is a generic function used to destroy string data.

pull_requests.title: Bug 1430181: Add an API endpoint (CrashStopData) to Socorro.
pull_requests.body: The purpose of this endpoint is to have in one shot all the data needed by the webextension CrashStop which displays crash data in Bugzilla.

pull_requests.title: Ack RMQ message on exactly same channel
pull_requests.body:
RMQ message should be acknowlodged on same channel and connection it was
recived. Lets store channel near with the message.
Here also removed rety on basic_ack since if ack failed connection or
channel error it means we could not ackowledge task anymore.

What led us to this issue is that if one of RMQ HA Cluster nodes fails we got lots of errors "unknown delivery tag" errors. And due to using transaction for  both `basic_get` and `basic_ack` this error could lead to very long performance degradation on processors. This is because every time "unknown delivery tag"  happen we close connection and all crashes we are processing now will get same error on save.

pull_requests.title: [WIP] 1409648 gc rule sets part 2
pull_requests.body:
I find the github UI + browser tabs are easier to manager than branch-to-branch and git stash locally, so here's a public WIP branch. early feedback is welcome.

notable changes:

Where did you get these? 

See https://github.com/mozilla/socorro/pull/1485

I think `TmPMMyXedc-Y_61AvnL6aXU96CRpUXMXj3TANP5PUmA` is supposed to be for `nose` and `6QTt-5DahBKcBiUs06BfkLTuvBu1uF7pblb_bPaUONU` for `mock`.
It means nothing. The tests aren't actually affected by its actual real content. The tests just makes sure the field is there.

Really happy that we're switching to nvd3. It's a great library. 

I do think we should use their minified version instead of trying to do it ourselves. For big libraries like that, the minification process is quite different. 
I think django-compressor will notice that it's already minified and thus won't need to be done again.
Any particular reason why this is done in the view and not in the template?
Are we using this file for anything? If so that's a bug. (not in the far future but for now it is)

review_comments.body: This file needs to be removed and `docs/_build` needs to be added to the socorro's `.gitignore`
These two paragraphs are now wrong.
Are you sure this will work with ReST?
RTD updates immediately if you commit to the master on socorro-docs on github. post-commit hook love
If this is a base class, name it so.
why isn't this self.get_parameters(...)?

oh, it's a staticmethod. right?
Still looking quite odd.
Why are all of these static methods? Generally using class methods is preferred and if there's a reason to make it a static method, it might deserve a comment in the code that explains 'why'.
remove and de-dent maybe. Makes for less indentation from hereon.
use `isinstance(array, list)` instead
`array is None` not `array == None`

``` python
super(Search, self).__init__(config)
```

and it'll run the __init__s of all super classes.

why not `utcnow()`? 

If `today()` (aka. `now()`) is a necessary hack, maybe it should be documented with a "hack warning" comment.

issue_comments.body: DId that, thanks Chris

commit_comments.body: FYI, the bug number in the commit is incorrect so it posted on the wrong bug in bugzilla.

Hi! I have a question about the current scheme (as I can see, it was mostly inherited in futher versions).

I see an error on execution `update_reports_clean` procedure.

```
File "/usr/lib/yandex/socorro/cron/reportsClean.py", line 20, in update_reports_clean\n    [startTime, timedelta(seconds=3600), False])
IntegrityError: null value in column "os_name" violates not-null constraint
CONTEXT:  SQL statement "INSERT INTO reports_clean_20121001
 ( uuid, date_processed, client_crash_date, product_version_id,
   build, signature_id, install_age, uptime,
   reason_id, address_id, os_name, os_version_id,
   hang_id, flash_version_id, process_type, release_channel,
   duplicate_of, domain_id )
SELECT uuid, date_processed, client_crash_date, product_version_id,
  build, signature_id, install_age, uptime,
  reason_id, address_id, os_name, os_version_id,
  hang_id, flash_version_id, process_type, release_channel,
  duplicate_of, domain_id
FROM reports_clean_buffer;"
PL/pgSQL function "update_reports_clean" line 271 at EXECUTE statement
```

Crash report was not processed properly and that caused NULL value in the os_name column.
I'd like to filter null values to delete this rows from reports_clean and add them into the reports_bad.
Oh, sorry, I was wrong, It's my fault.

I've faced with error because of this line. The problem is databaseConnection is not updated in the whole loop, so if connection to the database is lost, it will not be established again. I'd recommend to introduce `invalidate` method to the `databaseConnectionPool` or exit monitor at this point.
If an exception was raised, threads in the threadPool are not stopped properly, so the whole process remains alive forewer.

signature is a text in the `signatures` table.
I've graphed a histogram with a signature length distribution, and I have about 3% of long signatures that causes an exception:

```
FIle "socorro/processor/processor.py", line 587
threadLocalCursor.execute(reportsSql, infoTuple)
DataError: value too long for type character varying(255)
```
Thanks!

Out of curiosity, what does this `12345` mean? If it's some kind of docstring, you should know that `AsyncShutdownTimeout` is actually a JSON string with a number of fields that I can provide if you need them.
Wrong bug number ;-)

review_comments.body: One of the sessions I attended at DjangoCon pointed out that Postgres doesn't handle this quite like you'd expect. Postgres doesn't start at the offset and count up to the limit; it still figures out the result set and then just returns to you the subset you've asked for. In some cases, Postgres can actually work HARDER with a LIMIT ... OFFSET than it would otherwise. Just FYI in case it ever becomes an issue.
Doubt you actually want this in production. :-)

The suggestion of the presenter was to determine if it's faster to pull the whole result set and process it in memory, as opposed to on disk or in Postgres. Again, this is in an extreme case, but given our volume of data I wanted to bring this up as a "just in case." I expect this will work just fine.
We typically don't sign our code. Github will remember who wrote what for future reference, and we can pull that information with blame.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1431162: Fix errors in crontabber_status.js due to D3/sankey updates.
pull_requests.body:
- Fix some inconsistent indenting that was failing eslint.
- The `d.x`, `d.y`, and `d.dy` attributes on sankey datums appears to have been
  replaced with `d.x0`, `d.x1`, `d.y0`, and `d.y1`. So we replace all old
  attributes with the new ones (dy is computed from y0 and y1).
- Pass nodes and links via the sankey constructor.
- Replace `sankey.nodeWidth` call with a property computed from the datum's `x0`
  and `x1` values.
- Replace `sankey.update` with `sankey.relayout`.
- Replace `sankey.link` with `d3.sankeyLinkHorizontal`.

Most of these changes were found in the release notes on the sankey Github:
https://github.com/d3/d3-sankey/releases.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1429431: Use pyup to monitor and update e2e-tests dependencies.
pull_requests.body:
This PR does a few things:

1. Moves the dependency config for the e2e-tests into `e2e-tests/requirements/default.txt` and adds a constriants file for indirect dependencies. Both of these files perform hash checks for downloaded packages.
2. Adds the newly-created e2e-tests requirements to the pyup config.
3. Removes the `flake8` environment from the tox config, instead using the existing automation we have for linting python code in CircleCI and TravisCI. I'm not sure if this is being actively run anywhere.

   The downside of this is that we can't ignore line length only for the e2e-tests subdirectory, so I fixed the linting errors that this change brought up.

@stephendonner @chartjes Ya'll probably wanna look over this too before we merge it in case I've unknowingly broken some automation I'm not aware of or am otherwise messing up your stuff. This change will make it so that a PR for updating the test dependencies will be automatically filed once a month by the pyup bot, saving ya'll some human effort. :D

commit_comments.body: Debugging left

Where did you get these? 

See https://github.com/mozilla/socorro/pull/1485

I think `TmPMMyXedc-Y_61AvnL6aXU96CRpUXMXj3TANP5PUmA` is supposed to be for `nose` and `6QTt-5DahBKcBiUs06BfkLTuvBu1uF7pblb_bPaUONU` for `mock`.
It means nothing. The tests aren't actually affected by its actual real content. The tests just makes sure the field is there.

Really happy that we're switching to nvd3. It's a great library. 

I do think we should use their minified version instead of trying to do it ourselves. For big libraries like that, the minification process is quite different. 
I think django-compressor will notice that it's already minified and thus won't need to be done again.
Any particular reason why this is done in the view and not in the template?

oh, it's a staticmethod. right?

`array is None` not `array == None`

super(Search, self).__init__(config)

and it'll run the __init__s of all super classes.

commit_comments.body: FYI, the bug number in the commit is incorrect so it posted on the wrong bug in bugzilla.

Hi! I have a question about the current scheme (as I can see, it was mostly inherited in futher versions).

I see an error on execution `update_reports_clean` procedure.

```
File "/usr/lib/yandex/socorro/cron/reportsClean.py", line 20, in update_reports_clean\n    [startTime, timedelta(seconds=3600), False])
IntegrityError: null value in column "os_name" violates not-null constraint
CONTEXT:  SQL statement "INSERT INTO reports_clean_20121001
 ( uuid, date_processed, client_crash_date, product_version_id,
   build, signature_id, install_age, uptime,
   reason_id, address_id, os_name, os_version_id,
   hang_id, flash_version_id, process_type, release_channel,
   duplicate_of, domain_id )
SELECT uuid, date_processed, client_crash_date, product_version_id,
  build, signature_id, install_age, uptime,
  reason_id, address_id, os_name, os_version_id,
  hang_id, flash_version_id, process_type, release_channel,
  duplicate_of, domain_id
FROM reports_clean_buffer;"
PL/pgSQL function "update_reports_clean" line 271 at EXECUTE statement
```

Crash report was not processed properly and that caused NULL value in the os_name column.
I'd like to filter null values to delete this rows from reports_clean and add them into the reports_bad.
Oh, sorry, I was wrong, It's my fault.

I've faced with error because of this line. The problem is databaseConnection is not updated in the whole loop, so if connection to the database is lost, it will not be established again. I'd recommend to introduce `invalidate` method to the `databaseConnectionPool` or exit monitor at this point.
If an exception was raised, threads in the threadPool are not stopped properly, so the whole process remains alive forewer.

signature is a text in the `signatures` table.
I've graphed a histogram with a signature length distribution, and I have about 3% of long signatures that causes an exception:

```
FIle "socorro/processor/processor.py", line 587
threadLocalCursor.execute(reportsSql, infoTuple)
DataError: value too long for type character varying(255)
```
Thanks!

Out of curiosity, what does this `12345` mean? If it's some kind of docstring, you should know that `AsyncShutdownTimeout` is actually a JSON string with a number of fields that I can provide if you need them.
Wrong bug number ;-)

review_comments.body: One of the sessions I attended at DjangoCon pointed out that Postgres doesn't handle this quite like you'd expect. Postgres doesn't start at the offset and count up to the limit; it still figures out the result set and then just returns to you the subset you've asked for. In some cases, Postgres can actually work HARDER with a LIMIT ... OFFSET than it would otherwise. Just FYI in case it ever becomes an issue.
Doubt you actually want this in production. :-)

The suggestion of the presenter was to determine if it's faster to pull the whole result set and process it in memory, as opposed to on disk or in Postgres. Again, this is in an extreme case, but given our volume of data I wanted to bring this up as a "just in case." I expect this will work just fine.
We typically don't sign our code. Github will remember who wrote what for future reference, and we can pull that information with blame.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #4295 from Osmose/robust-poly-errors

Make the string representation of PolyStorageError more robust.
Make the string representation of PolyStorageError more robust.

Merge pull request #4290 from Osmose/setup-data

Fix bug 1399305: Script deletion and creation of S3 bucket and ES indices in development environment.

Review fixes.

- Fix S3 bucket script to ignore an error if the dev_bucket does not
  exist.
- Correct comment in run_update_data.sh.
- Log which indices are being deleted by the clear_es_indices app.
- Stop using minimum_es_version decorator in some tests.
- Improve how we parse a date from a socorro index name.

Include awscli in base requirements for single setup script.

This lets us remove some complexity around installing awscli, and allows the
make dockersetup commands to be executed by a single container.

Fix bug 1399305: Script elasticsearch index creation and deletion.

Modifies `make dockersetup` to clear out all Elasticsearch indexes, and
`make dockerupdatedata` to create Elasticsearch indexes for the next two weeks.
Bug 1399305: Delete and recreate dev S3 bucket in dockersetup.

Merge pull request #4289 from Osmose/fix-homepage

Fix bug 1429829: Use functions for `interpolate` param of metricsgraphics.js
Remind users of the system checklist to look at the JS console.

Fix bug 1429829: Use a function for the graph interpolate argument.

This changed in v2.10 of metricsgraphics.js, due to D3 v4.0 changes to how
shapes work. See also
https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/6480d20b3a352fcb579cd36ac34cfbb1f34b88c0/CHANGES.md#shapes-d3-shape.

Use un-minified source code as input for several libraries.

This makes it much easier to read errors during development since we're not
using minified files.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1431162: Fix errors in crontabber_status.js due to D3/sankey updates.
pull_requests.body:
- Fix some inconsistent indenting that was failing eslint.
- The `d.x`, `d.y`, and `d.dy` attributes on sankey datums appears to have been
  replaced with `d.x0`, `d.x1`, `d.y0`, and `d.y1`. So we replace all old
  attributes with the new ones (dy is computed from y0 and y1).
- Pass nodes and links via the sankey constructor.
- Replace `sankey.nodeWidth` call with a property computed from the datum's `x0`
  and `x1` values.
- Replace `sankey.update` with `sankey.relayout`.
- Replace `sankey.link` with `d3.sankeyLinkHorizontal`.

Most of these changes were found in the release notes on the sankey Github:
https://github.com/d3/d3-sankey/releases.

pull_requests.title: Fix bug 1429431: Use pyup to monitor and update e2e-tests dependencies.
pull_requests.body:
This PR does a few things:

1. Moves the dependency config for the e2e-tests into `e2e-tests/requirements/default.txt` and adds a constriants file for indirect dependencies. Both of these files perform hash checks for downloaded packages.
2. Adds the newly-created e2e-tests requirements to the pyup config.
3. Removes the `flake8` environment from the tox config, instead using the existing automation we have for linting python code in CircleCI and TravisCI. I'm not sure if this is being actively run anywhere.

   The downside of this is that we can't ignore line length only for the e2e-tests subdirectory, so I fixed the linting errors that this change brought up.

@stephendonner @chartjes Ya'll probably wanna look over this too before we merge it in case I've unknowingly broken some automation I'm not aware of or am otherwise messing up your stuff. This change will make it so that a PR for updating the test dependencies will be automatically filed once a month by the pyup bot, saving ya'll some human effort. :D

commits.message:
Merge pull request #4296 from amccreight/patch-14

Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

Merge pull request #4292 from willkg/1424659-spaces

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures
Merge three similar test cases into a single test case

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures

Prior to this, it was possible (though rare) to have two spaces in a row
in signatures. That's tough because the webui shows that as a single
space and if you search for the single-space version, you won't get any
results.

This fixes that by establishing that signatures can't have more than 1
consecutive whitespace character. Further, this makes sure that all
non-space whitespace characters are converted to space and this
happens all before we truncate the signature.

I also changed SigTrunc to SigTruncate because "trunc" is an unnecessary
abbreviation.

Merge pull request #4287 from willkg/1371428-nix-quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix ' to '' in signature generation

For years, there's been a bit of code to "escape single quotes" in
Java and C signatures. As near as I can tell, it predates the current
era of Socorro requirements and was likely added for some reason that
is no longer relevant.

One consequence is that it makes searching for frames harder, so this
removes that behavior.

Cleanup JavaSignatureRule tests

This renames all the JavaSignatureRule tests so they indicate what they're
testing. Plus it removes a couple of tests that are either an identical
duplicate or a close-enough-that-it's-effectively-the-same-thing duplicate.

Merge pull request #4288 from willkg/1416841-drop-dotstar

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

Since each line is a regexp that's joined with others with | and then
used with .match(), they're effectively all "startswith" type matches
so the .* at the end is superfluous.

Merge pull request #4286 from willkg/1426186-reprocess-help

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto
Reword note about balancing crash id production and consumption
Clarify how to specify a sleep value of 10

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto

This adds some crude documentation for reprocessing crashes including some
hand-wavey warnings about being cautious about adding crash ids to the queue
faster than they can be processed.

Merge pull request #4284 from willkg/1429434-rtd-fix

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

Simplify the Makefile

This moves the cp to always happen in the catch-all target rather than as
a separate target.

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

This fixes the docs build scripts such that readthedocs will copy the
e2e-tests README before building the docs. Otherwise, the e2e-tests README
doesn't get compiled into the docs on readthedocs.

Merge pull request #4283 from willkg/1155165-truncate

fixes bug 1155165 - truncate in one place
Fix SigTrunc to use a constant

pull_requests.title: fixes bug 1416340 - use secure args for ES connections
pull_requests.body:
If the `elasticsearch_urls` are all https, then we should be passing in
`verify_certs=True` and `use_ssl=True` args into the Elasticsearch
connection.

pull_requests.title: bug 1431442 - add "mark-success" to crontabber app
pull_requests.body:
This makes it easier to set up initial crontabber bookkeeping state in
the local development environment without having to run all the crontabber
jobs.

Mike: Do you think this helps? Is it good enough for a first pass? We can also do one for marking jobs as failed. I think that covers basic cases and after that it's probably easier to drop into psql and edit the db manually.

commits.message:
Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

ReleaseData is a generic function used to destroy string data.

pull_requests.title: Bug 1430181: Add an API endpoint (CrashStopData) to Socorro.
pull_requests.body: The purpose of this endpoint is to have in one shot all the data needed by the webextension CrashStop which displays crash data in Bugzilla.

pull_requests.title: Ack RMQ message on exactly same channel
pull_requests.body:
RMQ message should be acknowlodged on same channel and connection it was
recived. Lets store channel near with the message.
Here also removed rety on basic_ack since if ack failed connection or
channel error it means we could not ackowledge task anymore.

What led us to this issue is that if one of RMQ HA Cluster nodes fails we got lots of errors "unknown delivery tag" errors. And due to using transaction for  both `basic_get` and `basic_ack` this error could lead to very long performance degradation on processors. This is because every time "unknown delivery tag"  happen we close connection and all crashes we are processing now will get same error on save.

pull_requests.body:
This PR does a few things:

1. Moves the dependency config for the e2e-tests into `e2e-tests/requirements/default.txt` and adds a constriants file for indirect dependencies. Both of these files perform hash checks for downloaded packages.
2. Adds the newly-created e2e-tests requirements to the pyup config.
3. Removes the `flake8` environment from the tox config, instead using the existing automation we have for linting python code in CircleCI and TravisCI. I'm not sure if this is being actively run anywhere.

   The downside of this is that we can't ignore line length only for the e2e-tests subdirectory, so I fixed the linting errors that this change brought up.

@stephendonner @chartjes Ya'll probably wanna look over this too before we merge it in case I've unknowingly broken some automation I'm not aware of or am otherwise messing up your stuff. This change will make it so that a PR for updating the test dependencies will be automatically filed once a month by the pyup bot, saving ya'll some human effort. :D

commits.message:
Merge pull request #4296 from amccreight/patch-14

Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

Merge pull request #4292 from willkg/1424659-spaces

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures
Merge three similar test cases into a single test case

fixes bug 1424659 - nix consecutive spaces in signatures

Prior to this, it was possible (though rare) to have two spaces in a row
in signatures. That's tough because the webui shows that as a single
space and if you search for the single-space version, you won't get any
results.

This fixes that by establishing that signatures can't have more than 1
consecutive whitespace character. Further, this makes sure that all
non-space whitespace characters are converted to space and this
happens all before we truncate the signature.

I also changed SigTrunc to SigTruncate because "trunc" is an unnecessary
abbreviation.

Merge pull request #4287 from willkg/1371428-nix-quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix quotes

fixes bug 1371428 - nix ' to '' in signature generation

For years, there's been a bit of code to "escape single quotes" in
Java and C signatures. As near as I can tell, it predates the current
era of Socorro requirements and was likely added for some reason that
is no longer relevant.

One consequence is that it makes searching for frames harder, so this
removes that behavior.

Cleanup JavaSignatureRule tests

This renames all the JavaSignatureRule tests so they indicate what they're
testing. Plus it removes a couple of tests that are either an identical
duplicate or a close-enough-that-it's-effectively-the-same-thing duplicate.

Merge pull request #4288 from willkg/1416841-drop-dotstar

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

fixes bug 1416841 - nix .* at end of lines in siglist files

Since each line is a regexp that's joined with others with | and then
used with .match(), they're effectively all "startswith" type matches
so the .* at the end is superfluous.

Merge pull request #4286 from willkg/1426186-reprocess-help

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto
Reword note about balancing crash id production and consumption
Clarify how to specify a sleep value of 10

fixes bug 1426186 - add reprocessing howto

This adds some crude documentation for reprocessing crashes including some
hand-wavey warnings about being cautious about adding crash ids to the queue
faster than they can be processed.

Merge pull request #4284 from willkg/1429434-rtd-fix

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

Simplify the Makefile

This moves the cp to always happen in the catch-all target rather than as
a separate target.

fixes bug 1429434 - fix e2e-tests README missing in RTD

This fixes the docs build scripts such that readthedocs will copy the
e2e-tests README before building the docs. Otherwise, the e2e-tests README
doesn't get compiled into the docs on readthedocs.

Merge pull request #4283 from willkg/1155165-truncate

fixes bug 1155165 - truncate in one place
Fix SigTrunc to use a constant

pull_requests.title: fixes bug 1416340 - use secure args for ES connections
pull_requests.body:
If the `elasticsearch_urls` are all https, then we should be passing in
`verify_certs=True` and `use_ssl=True` args into the Elasticsearch
connection.

pull_requests.title: bug 1431442 - add "mark-success" to crontabber app
pull_requests.body:
This makes it easier to set up initial crontabber bookkeeping state in
the local development environment without having to run all the crontabber
jobs.

Mike: Do you think this helps? Is it good enough for a first pass? We can also do one for marking jobs as failed. I think that covers basic cases and after that it's probably easier to drop into psql and edit the db manually.

commits.message:
Bug 1431167 - Add ReleaseData to the prefix list

ReleaseData is a generic function used to destroy string data.

pull_requests.title: Bug 1430181: Add an API endpoint (CrashStopData) to Socorro.
pull_requests.body: The purpose of this endpoint is to have in one shot all the data needed by the webextension CrashStop which displays crash data in Bugzilla.

pull_requests.title: Ack RMQ message on exactly same channel
pull_requests.body:
RMQ message should be acknowlodged on same channel and connection it was
recived. Lets store channel near with the message.
Here also removed rety on basic_ack since if ack failed connection or
channel error it means we could not ackowledge task anymore.

What led us to this issue is that if one of RMQ HA Cluster nodes fails we got lots of errors "unknown delivery tag" errors. And due to using transaction for  both `basic_get` and `basic_ack` this error could lead to very long performance degradation on processors. This is because every time "unknown delivery tag"  happen we close connection and all crashes we are processing now will get same error on save.

I'd like to filter null values to delete this rows from reports_clean and add them into the reports_bad.
Oh, sorry, I was wrong, It's my fault.

I've faced with error because of this line. The problem is databaseConnection is not updated in the whole loop, so if connection to the database is lost, it will not be established again. I'd recommend to introduce `invalidate` method to the `databaseConnectionPool` or exit monitor at this point.
If an exception was raised, threads in the threadPool are not stopped properly, so the whole process remains alive forewer.

signature is a text in the `signatures` table.

```
FIle "socorro/processor/processor.py", line 587
threadLocalCursor.execute(reportsSql, infoTuple)
DataError: value too long for type character varying(255)
```
Thanks!

Wrong bug number ;-)

review_comments.body: One of the sessions I attended at DjangoCon pointed out that Postgres doesn't handle this quite like you'd expect. Postgres doesn't start at the offset and count up to the limit; it still figures out the result set and then just returns to you the subset you've asked for. In some cases, Postgres can actually work HARDER with a LIMIT ... OFFSET than it would otherwise. Just FYI in case it ever becomes an issue.
Doubt you actually want this in production. :-)

The suggestion of the presenter was to determine if it's faster to pull the whole result set and process it in memory, as opposed to on disk or in Postgres. Again, this is in an extreme case, but given our volume of data I wanted to bring this up as a "just in case." I expect this will work just fine.
We typically don't sign our code. Github will remember who wrote what for future reference, and we can pull that information with blame.
